reset.title: Reset Posters

manual.title: Manual Mode (Semi-Automated)
manual.description: Create or replace posters manually with full control over search, source, and metadata.
manual.mediaTypeHint: Select whether you're searching for a movie or TV show poster
manual.urlPlaceholder: Or enter URL/path: C:\\path\\to\\image.jpg or https://url.to/image.jpg
manual.uploadHint: Upload a local image file or enter a direct URL/path to the source image
manual.titleHint: Title to display on the poster
manual.tmdbHintSeason: Search for TV shows on TMDB to find season posters
manual.tmdbHintTitleCard: Search for TV shows on TMDB to find episode stills
manual.tmdbHintStandard: Search for movies or TV shows on TMDB to find posters
manual.searchByIdHint: Year not required when searching by ID
manual.searchByIdWarning: Make sure to select the correct media type (Movie or TV) for the TMDB ID
manual.numericTitleWarning: Numeric title detected - Year is required for accurate search
manual.step1: The source picture is moved (if local) or downloaded (if URL)
manual.step2: Image is edited with your configured overlays and text
manual.step3: Final poster is placed in the asset location
manual.step4: Poster is synced to your media server

jellyfin.title: Jellyfin Sync Mode
jellyfin.description: üîÑ Sync all artwork from Plex to Jellyfin
jellyfin.syncInfo: This mode will synchronize every artwork you have in Plex to your Jellyfin server.
jellyfin.step1Text: The script requires that library names in Plex and Jellyfin match exactly for the sync to work.
jellyfin.step2Text: The script calculates the hash of artwork from both servers to determine if there are differences.
jellyfin.step3Text: Only syncs artwork if the hashes don't match, saving time and bandwidth.
jellyfin.tip: üí° Tip: This is handy if you want to run the sync after a Kometa run, so you have Kometa overlayed images in Jellyfin.
jellyfin.important: ‚ö†Ô∏è Important: Make sure both UseJellyfin and UsePlex are set to true in your config.json, and that library names match exactly.

emby.title: Emby Sync Mode
emby.description: üîÑ Sync all artwork from Plex to Emby
emby.syncInfo: This mode will synchronize every artwork you have in Plex to your Emby server.
emby.step1Text: The script requires that library names in Plex and Emby match exactly for the sync to work.
emby.step2Text: The script calculates the hash of artwork from both servers to determine if there are differences.
emby.step3Text: Only syncs artwork if the hashes don't match, saving time and bandwidth.
emby.tip: üí° Tip: This is handy if you want to run the sync after a Kometa run, so you have Kometa overlayed images in Emby.
emby.important: ‚ö†Ô∏è Important: Make sure both UseEmby and UsePlex are set to true in your config.json, and that library names match exactly.

header.title: How Posterizarr Works
header.subtitle: Automated poster management for your media library with intelligent overlay application and seamless integration

libraryScanning.title: Library Scanning
libraryScanning.description: Posterizarr autonomously scans your Plex, Jellyfin, or Emby server for libraries and media content.

artworkDiscovery.title: Artwork Discovery
artworkDiscovery.description: Searches multiple sources for high-quality artwork based on your language preferences.
details: Sources: Fanart.tv, TMDB, TVDB, Plex, IMDb

imageProcessing.title: Image Processing
imageProcessing.description: Transforms downloaded artwork with custom overlays, text, borders, and effects.

assetOrganization.title: Asset Organization
assetOrganization.description: Organizes processed assets using Kometa-compatible folder structure for seamless integration.

mediaServerUpload.title: Media Server Upload
mediaServerUpload.description: Directly uploads finished artwork to your media server or stores for Kometa integration.
details: Smart hash validation to skip duplicates

multiSource.title: Multi-Source Discovery
multiSource.text: Searches Fanart.tv, TMDB, TVDB, Plex, and IMDb

customOverlays.title: Custom Overlays
customOverlays.text: Apply borders, text, and gradient effects

kometaCompatible.title: Kometa Compatible
kometaCompatible.text: Seamless integration with Kometa folder structure

crossPlatform.title: Cross-Platform
crossPlatform.text: Works on Docker, Linux, Windows, macOS, and ARM

showcase.title: See It In Action
showcase.posterizarrDescription: High-quality artwork automatically downloaded and processed with your custom overlays
showcase.kometaDescription: Final results in your media server with additional Kometa overlays applied

cta.title: Ready to Transform Your Library?
cta.description: Posterizarr handles everything from artwork discovery to media server upload, giving you beautiful, consistent artwork across your entire collection.

technical.title: Technical Highlights
technical.smartCaching: Smart Caching: Only creates missing artwork, skipping existing assets
technical.hashValidation: Hash Validation: Prevents duplicate uploads using EXIF metadata
technical.rtlSupport: RTL Support: Right-to-left font rendering for Arabic & Hebrew
technical.backupMode: Backup Mode: Download and backup all existing Plex artwork
technical.automatedCleanup: Automated Cleanup: Removes assets when media is deleted

header.title: Auto Triggers
header.subtitle: Set up automatic poster creation when new media is added to your library

requirements.title: Requirements
requirements.docker: Tautulli and Posterizarr must both be running as Docker containers
requirements.windows: Tautulli and Posterizarr must be installed on the same Windows system

steps.title: Mount Posterizarr Directory to Tautulli
steps.description: Tautulli needs access to the Posterizarr directory to execute the trigger script.
steps.warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è The mount path is case-sensitive and must be exactly /posterizarr

code.label: Add this volume mount to your Tautulli docker-compose.yml:

steps.title: Download the Trigger Script
steps.description: Download trigger.py from GitHub and place it in your Tautulli scripts directory.
substeps: Place in Tautulli script directory (see Tautulli Wiki for location)

steps.title: Configure Tautulli Notification Agent
steps.description: Create a new Script notification agent in Tautulli.
substeps: Click 'Add a new notification agent' and select 'Script'
Select trigger.py from your script folder

steps.title: Set Triggers
steps.description: Configure when the script should run.

steps.title: Set Conditions
steps.description: Define which media types should trigger the script.
substeps: Set Media Type to: episode, movie, show, season
Optionally exclude libraries (e.g., YouTube) that don't have TMDB/TVDB IDs

steps.title: Configure Arguments
steps.description: Set the required arguments for the script to work properly.
steps.info: Do not modify this argument - the script requires this exact format

code.label: Go to Arguments tab ‚Üí Expand 'Recently Added' ‚Üí Paste:
code.content: <movie>RatingKey "{rating_key}" mediatype "{media_type}"</movie><show>RatingKey "{rating_key}" mediatype "{media_type}"</show><season>parentratingkey "{parent_rating_key}" mediatype "{media_type}"</season><episode>RatingKey "{rating_key}" parentratingkey "{parent_rating_key}" grandparentratingkey "{grandparent_rating_key}" mediatype "{media_type}"</episode>

steps.title: Configure Tautulli Notification Agent
steps.description: Create a new Script notification agent in Tautulli.
substeps: Click 'Add a new notification agent' and select 'Script'
Select Posterizarr.ps1 from your Posterizarr folder
Set script timeout to 0 (unlimited) - default 30 seconds will kill the script

steps.title: Set Triggers
steps.description: Configure when the script should run.

steps.title: Set Conditions
steps.description: Define which media types should trigger the script.
substeps: Set Media Type to: episode, movie, show, season
Optionally exclude libraries (e.g., YouTube) that don't have TMDB/TVDB IDs

steps.title: Configure Arguments
steps.description: Set the required arguments for the script to work properly.
steps.info: Do not modify this argument - the script requires this exact format

code.label: Go to Arguments tab ‚Üí Expand 'Recently Added' ‚Üí Paste:
code.content: <movie>RatingKey "{rating_key}" mediatype "{media_type}"</movie><show>RatingKey "{rating_key}" mediatype "{media_type}"</show><season>parentratingkey "{parent_rating_key}" mediatype "{media_type}"</season><episode>RatingKey "{rating_key}" parentratingkey "{parent_rating_key}" grandparentratingkey "{grandparent_rating_key}" mediatype "{media_type}"</episode>

requirements.title: Requirements
requirements.description: Sonarr and Posterizarr must both be running as Docker containers

howItWorks: Sonarr creates a .posterizarr file in the watcher directory when a file is imported
The file contains metadata about the imported episode
Posterizarr monitors this directory for new files
When detected, Posterizarr waits up to 5 minutes (based on file age)
Then reads the file and triggers a poster creation run for that specific item

steps.title: Mount Posterizarr Directory to Sonarr
steps.description: Sonarr needs write access to the Posterizarr watcher directory.
steps.warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è The mount path is case-sensitive and must be exactly /posterizarr

code.label: Add this volume mount to your Sonarr docker-compose.yml:

steps.title: Download the Trigger Script
steps.description: Download ArrTrigger.sh from GitHub and place it in your Sonarr scripts directory.

steps.title: Configure Sonarr Connect Settings
steps.description: Add a custom script connection in Sonarr.
substeps: Click the '+' button and select 'Custom Script'

steps.title: Set Notification Trigger
steps.description: Configure when the script should execute.

steps.title: Set Script Path
steps.description: Point Sonarr to the trigger script.
steps.info: The path should be relative to your Sonarr container's file system

steps.title: Test and Save
steps.description: Verify the configuration works correctly.
substeps: Click 'Test' to ensure Sonarr can execute the script

requirements.title: Requirements
requirements.description: Radarr and Posterizarr must both be running as Docker containers

howItWorks: Radarr creates a .posterizarr file in the watcher directory when a file is imported
The file contains metadata about the imported movie
Posterizarr monitors this directory for new files
When detected, Posterizarr waits up to 5 minutes (based on file age)
Then reads the file and triggers a poster creation run for that specific item

steps.title: Mount Posterizarr Directory to Radarr
steps.description: Radarr needs write access to the Posterizarr watcher directory.
steps.warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è The mount path is case-sensitive and must be exactly /posterizarr

code.label: Add this volume mount to your Radarr docker-compose.yml:

steps.title: Download the Trigger Script
steps.description: Download ArrTrigger.sh from GitHub and place it in your Radarr scripts directory.

steps.title: Configure Radarr Connect Settings
steps.description: Add a custom script connection in Radarr.
substeps: Click the '+' button and select 'Custom Script'

steps.title: Set Notification Trigger
steps.description: Configure when the script should execute.

steps.title: Set Script Path
steps.description: Point Radarr to the trigger script.
steps.info: The path should be relative to your Radarr container's file system

steps.title: Test and Save
steps.description: Verify the configuration works correctly.
substeps: Click 'Test' to ensure Radarr can execute the script
